<datafield tag="100" ind1="1" ind2=" ">
<subfield code="a">Eichler-Levine, Jodi</subfield>
</datafield>
<datafield tag="245" ind1="1" ind2=" ">
<subfield code="a"><i>Jewish Identity in American Art: A Golden Age since the 1970s</i> by Matthew Baigell (review)</subfield>
</datafield>
<datafield tag="260" ind1=" " ind2=" ">
<subfield code="b">Johns Hopkins University Press</subfield>
<subfield code="c">Oct 2021</subfield>
</datafield>
<datafield tag="513" ind1=" " ind2=" ">
<subfield code="a">Book Review</subfield>
</datafield>
<datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" ">
<subfield code="a">Jewish Identity in American Art is strongest when its author deploys close readings of the images at hand, often interspersed with artist statements and quotes from interviews.

The book would be helpful both for teaching recent Jewish art history and as an introduction for readers who are unfamiliar with the scope of the field.

Jodi Eichler-Levine Jodi Eichler-Levine is Berman Professor of Religion Studies and Associate Professor of Religion Studies at Lehigh University.</subfield>
</datafield>
